title: Digital Ecology-Based Language Learning Interaction Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and no prior language learning experience
context.additional_context: Non-degree program for strengthening job-seeking individuals' vocational competencies

learning_goals: Learners can complete language tasks by applying three or more interaction strategies (feedback loops, peer review, multimedia utilization) on digital platforms (LMS, collaboration tools)
Learners can map cognitive (learning record analysis), affective (emotion journaling), and technological (tool integration) interaction elements according to an integrated ecology model framework
Through biweekly project deliverables, learners can explain dynamic relational patterns between learners-content-instructors in virtual learning environments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
